Posts.Signature: BD: 1/29/48 My PSA has been up and down from Prostatitis for 15 years 1st prostate biopsy April 2006, Negative PSA testing twice a year since 2006 PSA 9.5, May 2014  took a round of antibiotics  no change 2nd biopsy, June 2014  12 core samples  cancer in 10% of one core - Adenocarcinoma  Gleason 3+3=6 Polaris score indicates non aggressive cancer Radical Prostatectomy on 8/5/14, Methodist Le Bonheur Germantown Hospital - Germantown, TN Discharged 8/6/14 Catheter removed 8/19/14, started back to work 9/2/14 Experiencing some Ed and incontinence post op First post op checkup on 11/18/14. PSA = <0.05 Update July 2018: 99% continent 6 months post op Complete sexual function returned within a year post op

Posts.Title: Merry Christmas Everyone!

Posts.Content: I had some bouts with ED since surgery in 2014. Now erections are basically normal. I felt BP medication was causing some ED last year so I made a medication change and that has helped for sure. I tried Cialis twice last year (before medication change) but it just did not work for me. Highlander is correct about taking up to two years sometimes. I can agree with that based on my experience. Do not be surprised if you feel a change almost over night. Good luck! Steve

Posts.Title: 5 months post surgery update

Posts.Content: Thanks so much for the comments. When you reference 7 kegels a day are you meaning 7 sets (one set being flex (hold 10 seconds), rest (hold 10 seconds), flex (hold 10), rest (hold 10), flex (hold 10)? I received an exercise guide from my urologist to start with 10 sets per day for 1st week, increase to 15 sets per day for 2nd week, increase to 20 sets per day for 3rd week, increase to 25 or 30 sets per day for 4th week (I am at work and trying to recall the schedule). I currently get sore at 15 sets per day.
Posts.Title: Incontinence

Posts.Content: I had prostate surgery 8/5/14 and am struggling with incontinence. I am 66 years old. I started back to work on 9/2/14 and wear Depend underwear 24-7. I am continuing to do kegel exercises but have to slack off sometimes because of soreness. I have read comments that incontinence can take a year to improve. Seems like the general opinion is to have patience, it will improve eventually. Question I have is do the pelvic muscles and other muscles that control urine flow heal themselves from surgery over time whether I do kegel exercises or not? Thanks for your comments.
Posts.Title: Incontinence
